page.title: 03HURST CASTLE
page.content:
It was built in 1538 by Henry V111, king of England.The castle is one of a series built around the south coast.There are others at Southsea, Netley, Calshot, Sandown, East and West Cows and Yarmouth.It took many men to build it.You can visit half of it, the other half is being repaired.
I think it is a good place to visit.There is an exhibition, dungeons and a Tudor tower. Half of it is closed off. Before you go in you have to pay at a place where you can buy things.On the whole it isnt very exiting but its worth the visit.
